sentences.english: a paper carrying the front-page headline: ‘Space Aliens meet with President’
sentences.chinese: 头版报道题为“天外来客会见总统”的报纸

detailed_translations.chinese: 大标题；内容提要；栏外标题；头版头条新闻
detailed_translations.english: the title of a newspaper report, which is printed in large letters above the report

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…加标题；使成为注意中心；大力宣传
detailed_translations.english: to give a headline to an article or story

name: body
trans: (尤指建筑, 车辆或书, 文章等的)主体, 主要部份

sentences.english: the human body
sentences.chinese: 人体

sentences.english: My fingers were numb and my whole body ached.
sentences.chinese: 我手指麻木，浑身疼痛。

sentences.english: He needs to overcome a negative body image (=  what you think about your own body  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他需要克服对自己身体的负面印象。

sentences.english: A dog found the body of a girl in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 一条狗在树林里发现了一具女孩的尸体。

sentences.english: the main body of the text
sentences.chinese: 课文的正文

detailed_translations.english: the physical structure of a person or animal

sentences.english: the opening paragraphs of the novel
sentences.chinese: 小说开篇的几个段落

detailed_translations.english: part of a piece of writing which starts on a new line and contains at least one sentence

name: national
trans: 全国性的, 民族的, 国家的

sentences.english: Religion matters very much at a national level.
sentences.chinese: 宗教事务在全国都非常重要。

sentences.english: Between 1929 and 1933 America’s national income fell by more than half.
sentences.chinese: 1929至1933年间，美国的国民收入下降过半。

sentences.english: There are strong indications that the Prime Minister will call national elections in May.
sentences.chinese: 有明显迹象预示首相将于5月召集全国大选。

detailed_translations.english: related to a whole nation as opposed to any of its parts

sentences.english: the response of the international community
sentences.chinese: 国际社会的反响

sentences.english: the UN and other international organizations
sentences.chinese: 联合国和其他国际组织

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving more than one nation

sentences.english: a successful economy
sentences.chinese: 发展成功的经济

sentences.english: the slowdown in the Japanese economy
sentences.chinese: 日本经济的减缓

sentences.english: The gas fire was turned low for reasons of economy.
sentences.chinese: 为了节省，把煤气取暖器开小了。

detailed_translations.english: the system by which a country’s money and goods are produced and used, or a country considered in this way

name: affair
trans: 事务, 政治事件, 大事

sentences.english: Are you interested in world affairs?
sentences.chinese: 你对世界大事感兴趣吗？

sentences.english: the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
sentences.chinese: 外交部

sentences.english: Women had little role in public affairs.
sentences.chinese: 女性过去几乎不参与公共事务。

sentences.english: the Watergate affair
sentences.chinese: 水门事件

sentences.english: He had an affair with his boss that lasted six years.
sentences.chinese: 他和老板的暧昧关系持续了六年。

detailed_translations.english: public or political events and activities

name: mindless
trans: 不小心的, 不顾虑的, 不留神的

sentences.english: The town provides a wide choice of entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 该镇提供各式各样的娱乐活动。

sentences.english: There will be live entertainment (= performed then, not recorded ) throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 现场表演将持续一整天。

sentences.english: The dolphins give good entertainment value (= a lot of amusement and interest ).
sentences.chinese: 海豚具有很高的娱乐价值。

detailed_translations.chinese: 娱乐， 文娱节目， 表演会； 招待， 款待， 请客
detailed_translations.english: things such as films, television, performances etc that are intended to amuse or interest people

sentences.english: a reasonable request
sentences.chinese: 合情合理的要求

sentences.english: Be reasonable — you can’t expect her to do all the work on her own!
sentences.chinese: 要讲道理，你不能指望她一个人干所有的工作！

sentences.english: I thought it was a perfectly reasonable (= completely reasonable ) question.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这个问题问得很有道理。

sentences.english: He had reasonable grounds (= good reasons but no proof ) for believing the law had been broken.
sentences.chinese: 他有合理的根据认为有人违法了。

sentences.english: good food at a reasonable price
sentences.chinese: 价格公道的美食

detailed_translations.english: fair and sensible

sentences.english: I’m worried about my husband’s health.
sentences.chinese: 我担心我丈夫的健康状况。

sentences.english: Even if you haven’t got much money, at least you’ve got your health.
sentences.chinese: 即使你没有太多钱，但起码你拥有健康。

detailed_translations.english: the general condition of your body and how healthy you are

sentences.english: Many leading scientists do not consider that science can give absolutely reliable knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 许多杰出科学家都不认为科学能够提供绝对可靠的知识。

sentences.english: the founder of modern science, Isaac Newton
sentences.chinese: 现代科学创始人艾萨克·牛顿

sentences.english: developments in science and technology
sentences.chinese: 科学技术的发展

detailed_translations.english: knowledge about the world, especially based on examining, testing, and proving facts

sentences.english: Ricky turned and walked away.
sentences.chinese: 里基转身走了。

sentences.english: She turned her head in surprise.
sentences.chinese: 她惊讶地转过头来。

sentences.english: Brigitte glared at him, turned on her heel (= turned away suddenly because of anger ) , and stomped out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 布丽吉特瞪了他一眼，猛地一转身，噔噔噔地走出了房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 转动，使旋转；转弯；翻过来；兑换
detailed_translations.english: to move your body so that you are looking in a different direction

detailed_translations.chinese: 转弯；变化；(损害或有益于别人的)行为，举动，举止
detailed_translations.english: a sudden or unexpected change that makes a situation develop in a different way

sentences.english: He lives just across the street from me.
sentences.chinese: 他就住在我街对面。

sentences.english: We live only a few miles from the coast.
sentences.chinese: 我们住的地方离海边只有几英里远。

sentences.english: A rather odd family came tolive next door to us.
sentences.chinese: 有一户相当奇怪的人家搬到了我们隔壁。

sentences.english: As soon as I saw the place, I knew I didn’t want to live there.
sentences.chinese: 我一看到那地方，就觉得不想住在那儿。

sentences.english: Does Paul stilllive here?
sentences.chinese: 保罗还住在这儿吗？

sentences.english: We’re still looking for somewhere to live.
sentences.chinese: 我们还在找住的地方。

sentences.english: They’ve finally found a place to live.
sentences.chinese: 他们终于找到了住的地方。

sentences.english: Most seventeen-year-olds still live at home(= live with their parents ).
sentences.chinese: 17 岁的孩子大都还住在家里。

sentences.english: I’m quite happy living alone.
sentences.chinese: 我一个人住很开心。

sentences.english: The house has 3,600 square feet of living space(= the areas of a house you live in ).
sentences.chinese: 这房子有3,600平方英尺的居住空间。

detailed_translations.english: if you live in a place, you have your home there
not dead or artificial

sentences.english: a recording studio in Nashville
sentences.chinese: 在纳什维尔的一间录音室

sentences.english: a photographer’s studio
sentences.chinese: 摄影师的工作室

detailed_translations.english: a room where television and radio programmes are made and broadcast or where music is recorded

name: moderate
trans: 温和主义者, 稳健派

sentences.english: Even moderate amounts of alcohol can be dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 喝酒即使不多也会有危险。

sentences.english: a moderate degree of success
sentences.chinese: 一定程度上的成功

sentences.english: a student of moderate ability
sentences.chinese: 能力一般的学生

sentences.english: Moderate exercise, such as walking, is recommended.
sentences.chinese: 建议适度锻炼，比如散步。

sentences.english: Bake the pie for 30 minutes in a moderate oven.
sentences.chinese: 馅饼用中火烘烤30分钟。

sentences.english: moderate to strong winds
sentences.chinese: 中到大风

detailed_translations.english: not very large or very small, very hot or very cold, very fast or very slow etc
someone whose opinions or beliefs, especially about politics, are not extreme and are considered reasonable by most people
to make something less extreme or violent, or to become less extreme or violent

sentences.english: Angry demonstrators demanded the resignation of two senior officials.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的示威者要求两名高级官员辞职。

sentences.english: ‘Where are you going?’ she demanded angrily.
sentences.chinese: “你要去哪里？” 她气愤地质问道。

detailed_translations.english: to ask for something very firmly, especially because you think you have a right to do this
the need or desire that people have for particular goods and services

sentences.english: The Obama administration and police officers around the country say no, and their precedent is the past.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马政府和全国各地的警官说不可以，他们引为依据的先例就是“过去”。

sentences.english: There is no historical precedent that can tell us what happens to established democracies when most citizens go years, even decades, without an improvement in their standard of living.
sentences.chinese: 没有历史先例能告诉我们，当大多数人民的生活水平在几年、甚至几十年间维持不变时，一个已经确立根基的民主国家会发生什么。

sentences.english: An east London school has set a precedent by fining pupils who break the rules.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦东区的一所学校开创了对违反校规的学生处以罚金的先例。

detailed_translations.english: an action or official decision that can be used to give support to later actions or decisions

name: jubilation
trans: 欢腾, 喜悦, 庆祝

sentences.english: Berlusconi submitted his resignation on Saturday as the nation grappled with a major debt crisis, to scenes of jubilation among thousands of people in the streets of Rome.
sentences.chinese: 贝卢斯科尼于上周六辞职，成千上万罗马民众走上街头庆祝。意大利近日深陷大规模债务危机。

name: challenger
trans: 挑战者,须全力应对的事物

sentences.english: The strongest challenger, Texas Democrat Martin Frost, has withdrawn from the race.
sentences.chinese: 最强劲的挑战者，德克萨斯州的民主党人马丁·弗罗斯特已经退出了竞选。

detailed_translations.english: A challenger is someone who competes with you for a position or title that you already have, for example being a sports champion or a political leader

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

sentences.english: Pete, are you going to make the introductions?
sentences.chinese: 皮特，你来作一下介绍吧。

sentences.english: Our first contestant needs no introduction (= everyone already knows the person ).
sentences.chinese: 我们的第一位参赛者就不用介绍了。

sentences.english: the introduction of Buddhism to China nearly 2,000 years ago
sentences.chinese: 约2,000年前佛教传入中国

sentences.english: In the introduction, he explains why he wrote the book.
sentences.chinese: 在引言里，他解释了写这本书的原因。

detailed_translations.english: the act of formally telling two people each other’s names when they first meet

sentences.english: This is Gavin Williams, reporting from the United Nations in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我是加文·威廉斯，在纽约联合国总部为您报道。

sentences.english: We aim to report the news as fairly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求公正地报道这一新闻。

sentences.english: The incident was widely reported in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这一事件在全国的媒体上被广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: to give people information about recent events, especially in newspapers and on television and radio

sentences.english: They are proposing radical changes to the way the company is run.
sentences.chinese: 他们建议对公司经营模式进行重大改革。

sentences.english: a radical reform of the tax system
sentences.chinese: 税收制度的彻底改革

sentences.english: There are radical differences between the two organizations.
sentences.chinese: 这两个组织有着根本差异。

detailed_translations.chinese: 根本的，基本的；激进的，激进派的
detailed_translations.english: a radical change or difference is very big and important
someone who has new and different ideas, especially someone who wants complete social and political change

sentences.english: The festival reaches its climax with the traditional boat-burning ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 传统的烧船仪式将节庆活动推向了高潮。

sentences.english: the climax of his naval career
sentences.chinese: 他海军生涯的巅峰

detailed_translations.english: the most exciting or important part of a story or experience, which usually comes near the end

sentences.english: Then, with sudden resolution, she stood up.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她突然很坚决地站了起来。

sentences.english: She made a resolution to visit her relatives more often.
sentences.chinese: 她决定要多走走亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being resolute or determined

sentences.english: Let me reiterate the most important points.
sentences.chinese: 我来把最重要的几点重申一遍。

detailed_translations.english: to repeat a statement or opinion in order to make your meaning as clear as possible

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

name: sarcasm
trans: 讥讽; 讽刺; 挖苦

sentences.english: ‘Good of you to arrive on time,’ George said, with heavy sarcasm (= very clear sarcasm ) .
sentences.chinese: “你到得真准时啊。”乔治不加掩饰地挖苦道。

detailed_translations.english: a way of speaking or writing that involves saying the opposite of what you really mean in order to make an unkind joke or to show that you are annoyed

sentences.english: You don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你不会恰巧还想得起他的名字吧？

sentences.english: As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 我记得，是你首先提出这个想法的。

sentences.english: Cole was recalled to the squad to replace the injured Quinn.
sentences.chinese: 科尔被召回队里代替受伤的奎因。

sentences.english: The cars had to be recalled due to an engine fault.
sentences.chinese: 由于发动机缺陷，那些汽车必须召回。

detailed_translations.english: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past

sentences.english: Was my name mentioned at all?
sentences.chinese: 我的名字被提到过吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

sentences.english: (= it is important enough to mention ) that they only studied a very small number of cases.
sentences.chinese: 必须说明的是他们仅研究了几个个案。

sentences.english: As I mentioned earlier , there have been a lot of changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

sentences.english: They all get a mention (= they are all mentioned ) in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

detailed_translations.english: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

sentences.english: We’d like two rooms with connecting doors (= doors that join the rooms ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们想要两个有门相通的房间。

sentences.english: I didn’t connect the two events in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 我心里没把这两件事联系起来。

detailed_translations.english: to join two or more things together

sentences.english: Ron does nothing but criticize and complain all the time.
sentences.chinese: 罗恩什么也不干，只是一味指责和抱怨。

sentences.english: The new law has been widely criticized .
sentences.chinese: 这项新法律受到了广泛的批评。

sentences.english: We look at each other’s work and criticize it.
sentences.chinese: 我们交换作品，互相提出批评意见。

detailed_translations.english: to express your disapproval of someone or something, or to talk about their faults

name: yell
trans: 号叫; 喊叫; 叫喊

sentences.english: ‘Help me!’ she yelled hysterically.
sentences.chinese: “救救我！”她歇斯底里地大叫。

sentences.english: I yelled out, ‘Here I am!’
sentences.chinese: 我大声喊道:“我在这儿！”

sentences.english: The crowd are on their feet yelling.
sentences.chinese: 观众站着高声呐喊。

sentences.english: He could hear Pete yelling at the top of his voice (= very loudly ).
sentences.chinese: 他听到皮特声嘶力竭地在喊叫。

detailed_translations.english: to shout or say something very loudly, especially because you are frightened, angry, or excited
a loud shout

sentences.english: a pat reply

detailed_translations.english: exactly right for the occasion; apt
a friendly act of touching someone with your hand flat
to lightly touch someone or something several times with your hand flat, especially to give comfort

sentences.english: She shook him to wake him up.
sentences.chinese: 她摇摇他，想把他叫醒。

sentences.english: Shake the bottle before you open it.
sentences.chinese: 打开瓶子之前先摇一摇。

sentences.english: The whole house started to shake.
sentences.chinese: 整幢房子摇晃起来。

sentences.english: The car shook as it went over a bump.
sentences.chinese: 汽车驶过一个隆起的地方时颠了一下。

sentences.english: The little boy’s hand was shaking.
sentences.chinese: 这小男孩的手在发抖。

sentences.english: Give the bottle a good shake before use.
sentences.chinese: 使用前要用力摇晃瓶子

sentences.english: His confidence was badly shaken.
sentences.chinese: 他的自信心受到很大的打击。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly from side to side or up and down, usually with a lot of force, or to make something or someone do this
if you give something a shake, you move it up and down or from side to side

sentences.english: Maggie leaned forward and kissed her cheek.
sentences.chinese: 玛吉俯身吻了她的脸颊。

sentences.english: Georgina took him in her arms and kissed him on the lips.
sentences.chinese: 乔治娜抱住他，吻他的嘴唇。

sentences.english: Jim and Mary kissed (= they kissed each other ).
sentences.chinese: 吉姆和玛丽接了吻。

detailed_translations.english: to touch someone with your lips as a greeting, to show them love, or as part of a sexual relationship
to touch someone with your lips as a greeting, to show them love, or as part of a sexual relationship
an act of kissing

sentences.english: We stood there crying and hugging each other.
sentences.chinese: 我们站在那里哭着互相拥抱。

sentences.english: She went to her daughter and hugged her tightly .
sentences.chinese: 她走到女儿身边，紧紧地拥抱她。

detailed_translations.english: to put your arms around someone and hold them tightly to show love or friendship
to put your arms around someone and hold them tightly to show love or friendship
the action of putting your arms around someone and holding them tightly to show love or friendship

sentences.english: She bowed and left the stage.
sentences.chinese: 她鞠了一躬，离开了舞台。

sentences.english: Corbett entered the room, bowing respectfully.
sentences.chinese: 科比特走进房间，恭敬地鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: The servant bowed low and handed his master the sealed note.
sentences.chinese: 仆人深深一鞠躬，把那个封好的短笺递给了主人。

sentences.english: This is done with a formal bow to the king or queen.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，还要向国王或女王正式鞠躬行礼。

detailed_translations.english: to bend the top part of your body forward in order to show respect for someone important, or as a way of thanking an  audience
the act of bending the top part of your body forward to show respect for someone when you meet them, or as a way of thanking an audience

sentences.english: the firm clasp of her hand
sentences.chinese: 她有力的握手

detailed_translations.english: a small metal object for fastening a bag, belt, piece of jewellery etc
to hold someone or something tightly, closing your fingers or arms around them

sentences.english: He was regarded as the most successful president of modern times.
sentences.chinese: 他被看成是近代最成功的总统。

detailed_translations.english: to think about someone or something in a particular way

sentences.english: We will have to consider your offer carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们得仔细考虑你的提议。

sentences.english: The local authority considered that the school did not meet requirements.
sentences.chinese: 当地政府认为这所学校达不到要求。

sentences.english: Have you considered my feelings?
sentences.chinese: 你考虑过我的感受吗？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something carefully, especially before making a choice or decision

sentences.english: a rude remark
sentences.chinese: 粗鲁的话

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to be rude, but I had to leave early.
sentences.chinese: 我并不想显得无礼，但我不得不早走。

detailed_translations.english: speaking or behaving in a way that is not polite and is likely to offend or annoy people

sentences.english: an impolite remark
sentences.chinese: 无礼的话

detailed_translations.english: not polite

sentences.english: The government has softened its stance on public spending.
sentences.chinese: 政府对公共开支问题的态度软化了。

detailed_translations.english: to become or to make sb/sth more sympathetic and less severe or critical

name: quite
trans: 相当, 完全, 十分, 很

sentences.english: I’m sorry. That’s quite impossible.
sentences.chinese: 我很抱歉，那是完全不可能的。

sentences.english: I felt quite bitter about it at the time.
sentences.chinese: 当时我对此感到相当痛苦。

sentences.english: Well, actually it requires quite a bit of work and research.
sentences.chinese: 呃，实际上这需要相当多的工作和研究。

sentences.english: I can see it quite clearly.
sentences.chinese: 我能清清楚楚地看见它。

detailed_translations.english: completely

name: depersonalize
trans: 去个人标签化，去个性化

sentences.english: I quite like the idea of going for a ramble one weekend.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得找个周末去乡下走走这个主意不错。

detailed_translations.english: a walk in the countryside for pleasure
to go on a walk in the countryside for pleasure

sentences.english: My letters to her have elicited no response.
sentences.chinese: 我写给她的信没有得到回应。

detailed_translations.english: If you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions

sentences.english: The woman greeted us with a nod of the head.
sentences.chinese: 那个女人向我们点点头打招呼。

sentences.english: I showed the doorman my card and he gave a friendly nod.
sentences.chinese: 我向门卫出示了卡片，他友善地点了点头。

detailed_translations.english: an act of nodding
to move your head up and down, especially in order to show agreement or understanding

sentences.english: Jim raised his hands in a despairing gesture.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆举起双手，做出绝望的手势。

sentences.english: The Queen has now made a gesture towards public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 女王现在摆出了尊重民意的姿态。

detailed_translations.english: a movement of part of your body, especially your hands or head, to show what you mean or how you feel

name: reserved
trans: 矜持的, 寡言的, 内向的

sentences.english: He was unemotional, quiet, and reserved.
sentences.chinese: 他不动感情、安静而矜持。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is reserved keeps their feelings hidden

sentences.english: He greeted me with a handshake and a glass of wine.
sentences.chinese: 他与我握手问候，并递给我一杯酒。

sentences.english: Her handshake was warm and firm.
sentences.chinese: 她的握手温暖而有力。

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking someone’s right hand and shaking it, which people do when they meet or leave each other or when they have made an agreement

sentences.english: She has a tendency to generalize from her husband to all men.
sentences.chinese: 她总爱把自己对丈夫的看法推及所有的男人。

detailed_translations.english: to form a general principle or opinion after considering only a small number of facts or examples

sentences.english: She stood nervously in the wings waiting for her cue.
sentences.chinese: 她紧张地站在台侧等待出场的提示。

detailed_translations.english: an action or event that is a signal for something else to happen
to give someone a sign that it is the right moment for them to speak or do something, especially during a performance

sentences.english: We have to discover his plans and act accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 我们得找出他的计划，照着办。

sentences.english: Some of the laws were contradictory. Accordingly, measures were taken to clarify them.
sentences.chinese: 有些法律相互矛盾，因此，采取了措施将其阐明。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is appropriate to what has been done or said in a particular situation

sentences.english: Looking after the house was viewed as a woman’s domain.
sentences.chinese: 料理家务被认为是女性的份内之事。

detailed_translations.english: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with

name: mindset
trans: 精神状态, 心态, 意向

sentences.english: UN forces made a strategic withdrawal.
sentences.chinese: 联合国部队作了战略性撤退。

sentences.english: strategic planning meetings
sentences.chinese: 战略计划会议

sentences.english: a strategic decision to move production to Hungary
sentences.chinese: 把生产转至匈牙利的战略决定

detailed_translations.english: done as part of a plan, especially in a military, business, or political situation

sentences.english: The company needs to develop a stronger orientation towards marketing its products.
sentences.chinese: 公司需要针对其产品的营销设定一个更为明确的目标。

sentences.english: How can we get students to adopt a serious orientation to learning?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样才能让学生对学习采取认真的态度呢？

detailed_translations.english: the type of activity or subject that a person or organization seems most interested in and gives most attention to

sentences.english: She was not an accountant and didn't have the expertise to verify all of the financial details.
sentences.chinese: 她不是会计，不具有核查所有这些财政细目的专业知识。

detailed_translations.english: Expertise is special skill or knowledge that is acquired by training, study, or practice

sentences.english: The US must now take a firm leadership role.
sentences.chinese: 美国现在必须扮演一个强有力的领导人角色。

sentences.english: the Conservative leadership contest
sentences.chinese: 保守党的领导人角逐

sentences.english: The next leadership election is due in November.
sentences.chinese: 下一届领导人选举将在十一月举行。

detailed_translations.english: the position of being the leader of a group, organization, country etc

sentences.english: Much of the land was of poor quality.
sentences.chinese: 很多地的土质很差。

sentences.english: Use only high quality ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 只使用上等的材料。

sentences.english: the drug’s addictive quality
sentences.chinese: 毒品令人上瘾的特性

detailed_translations.english: how good or bad something is

name: comfortable
trans: 自在的, 无忧无虑的

sentences.english: The bed wasn’t particularly comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 这床不大舒服。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel physically relaxed, without any pain or without being too hot, cold etc

sentences.english: The exhibition was only a partial success.
sentences.chinese: 那次展会只获得部分成功。

sentences.english: a partial solution to traffic congestion in Oxford
sentences.chinese: 部分解决牛津地区交通拥堵问题的方法

sentences.english: I might be accused of being partial.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会被人指责是偏袒的。

detailed_translations.english: not complete

sentences.english: My whole future now seemed uncertain.
sentences.chinese: 现在我的前途似乎是个未知数。

detailed_translations.english: feeling doubt about something

sentences.english: The government has promised that the army will be called in to help if there is a firemen’s strike.
sentences.chinese: 政府承诺，如消防员罢工，就将调军队来协助。

detailed_translations.english: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc

sentences.english: Reform now figures high on the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，改革是当务之急。

detailed_translations.english: to be an important part of a process, event, or situation, or to be included in something

detailed_translations.chinese: 数字；人物；算术；体型，风姿；轮廓；画像，塑像；图，图形
detailed_translations.english: the activity of adding, multiplying etc numbers

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算； 认为， 猜想
detailed_translations.english: to form a particular opinion after thinking about a situation

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。

sentences.english: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
sentences.chinese: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

sentences.english: If you have to cover 12 chapters in American history, begin by planning on three two-hour reviews with four chapters per session.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必须涵盖美国史的12个章节，首先计划3次2小时的复习，每次4章。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully examine or consider sth again, especially so that you can decide if it is necessary to make changes
(North Amercian English) a lesson in which you look again at sth you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam

sentences.english: I usually buy all my vegetables at the market.
sentences.chinese: 我通常都是在菜市场里购买蔬菜。

sentences.english: Our main overseas market is Japan.
sentences.chinese: 我们的主要海外市场是日本。

detailed_translations.english: a time when people buy and sell goods, food etc, or the place, usually outside or in a large building, where this happens

sentences.english: They’ll soon settle in – kids are very good at adjusting.
sentences.chinese: 他们很快就会习惯的——小孩子适应能力很强。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become familiar with a new situation
to change or move something slightly to improve it or make it more suitable for a particular purpose

sentences.english: Puppies are naturally curious.
sentences.chinese: 小狗天生好奇。

sentences.english: He felt a curious mixture of excitement and panic.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种既兴奋又惊慌的奇怪感觉。

detailed_translations.english: wanting to know about something

sentences.chinese: 最近的调查表明，女性的薪水仍比男性的要低很多。

sentences.english: The study was carried out between January and May 2008.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究是在 2008 年1月到5月间进行的。

sentences.english: Set aside a period of time specifically for study.
sentences.chinese: 留出一段时间专门用于学习

sentences.english: I’ve been studying English for six years
sentences.chinese: 我学英语已有六年了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 研究 (对某一课题或问题的)；中文释义: 学习 (尤指在家里或放学后的)
detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is done to find out more about a particular subject or problem, and usually includes a written report

detailed_translations.chinese: 中文释义: 学习，攻读
detailed_translations.english: to learn about a subject at school, university etc

sentences.english: It’s a good idea to do some research before you buy a house.
sentences.chinese: 买房子之前作些了解，这想法很对。

sentences.english: Gould was helped in his researches by local naturalists.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德在研究过程中得到了当地博物学家的帮助。

sentences.english: He’s been researching material for a documentary.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在研究材料，准备做一个纪录片。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of finding information about something that you are interested in or need to know about
to study a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new facts or test new ideas

name: keen
trans: 热衷的, 热心的, 热切的, 渴望(做某事)

sentences.english: keen students
sentences.chinese: 求知若渴的学生

sentences.english: The kids in my class are all very keen.
sentences.chinese: 我班上的学生都很好学。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

sentences.english: If someone invited me over to Florida, I’d jump at the chance (= use the opportunity eagerly ) .
sentences.chinese: 如果有人邀请我去佛罗里达，我会赶紧抓住这个机会。

sentences.english: There’s always the chance that something will go wrong.
sentences.chinese: 总有可能会出现问题。

sentences.english: If we did move to London, I’d stand a much better chance (= have a much better chance ) of getting a job.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们真的搬到伦敦去，我找到工作的机会就大多了。

sentences.english: There is little chance of her being found alive.
sentences.chinese: 她生还的可能性很小。

detailed_translations.english: a time or situation which you can use to do something that you want to do

name: willing
trans: 乐意的, 心甘情愿的, 自愿的

sentences.english: How much are they willing to pay?
sentences.chinese: 他们愿意付多少钱？

detailed_translations.english: prepared to do something, or having no reason to not want to do it

sentences.english: The sash, kimono, and other garments were made to fit a child.
sentences.chinese: 这些腰带、和服和其他衣服都做得适合孩子穿。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment into a place, or a new part onto a machine, so that it is ready to be used
if something fits another thing, it is similar to it or suitable for it

sentences.english: He was in urgent need of medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 他急需治疗。

sentences.english: The report called for urgent action to reduce lead in petrol.
sentences.chinese: 报告呼吁迅速采取行动，减少汽油中的铅含量。

sentences.english: an urgent message
sentences.chinese: 一封急报

detailed_translations.english: very important and needing to be dealt with immediately

trans: 优先权, 优先, 优先顺序

sentences.english: The club’s priority is to win the League.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部首先考虑的是要赢得联赛。

sentences.english: After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority (= very important and needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗入室盗窃案以后，治安成了当务之急。

sentences.english: With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority (= not important and not needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 可用的钱这么少，只好暂时放下维修事宜了。

sentences.english: The customer is high on our list of priorities .
sentences.chinese: 顾客在我们的心目中排在第一位。

sentences.english: List your tasks in order of priority (= most important first ) .
sentences.chinese: 按照轻重缓急列出你的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else

sentences.english: a low wooden table with a glass top
sentences.chinese: 玻璃桌面的矮木桌

detailed_translations.chinese: 顶部，顶端；上部；首席；陀螺
detailed_translations.english: the highest part of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 高出，超越；结束；达到顶点
detailed_translations.english: to be higher than a particular amount
nearest to the top of something

name: manage
trans: 设法做到, 勉力完成

sentences.english: He was asked to manage a new department.
sentences.chinese: 他被要求去管理一个新的部门。

sentences.english: Managing a football team is harder than you think.
sentences.chinese: 管理一支足球队比你想象的要难。

sentences.english: The company had been very badly managed.
sentences.chinese: 公司管理非常糟糕。

sentences.english: I don’t know how I’ll manage it , but I’ll be there.
sentences.chinese: 我还不知道怎么去，但我会去的。

sentences.english: I don’t know how she manages with seven children.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道七个孩子她是怎么应付的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理；设法；成功应付，对付
detailed_translations.english: to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it

sentences.english: The writer expresses himself correctly in English.
sentences.chinese: 作家用英语正确地表达自己的意思。

sentences.english: If you can use a word correctly and effectively, you comprehend it.
sentences.chinese: 你如果能正确和有效地使用一个字，你就了解它了。

detailed_translations.english: having no mistakes

sentences.english: We will have to consider your offer carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们得仔细考虑你的提议。

sentences.english: The local authority considered that the school did not meet requirements.
sentences.chinese: 当地政府认为这所学校达不到要求。

sentences.english: Have you considered my feelings?
sentences.chinese: 你考虑过我的感受吗？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something carefully, especially before making a choice or decision

sentences.english: road users
sentences.chinese: 道路使用者

sentences.english: a computer user
sentences.chinese: 电脑用户

sentences.english: library users
sentences.chinese: 图书馆的读者

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that uses a product, service etc

name: public
trans: 公众的, 公用的, 公共的

sentences.english: We have to show that publishing this story is in the public interest (= helpful or useful to ordinary people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须证明刊登这篇报道有利于公众。

sentences.english: full public access to information
sentences.chinese: 公众对信息的充分知情权

sentences.english: Public opinion is gradually shifting in favor of the imprisoned men.
sentences.chinese: 舆论渐渐倾向于同情入狱的男子。

sentences.english: There was a public outcry (= expression of anger by a lot of people ) about the shooting.
sentences.chinese: 公众就枪击事件发出了强烈抗议。

sentences.english: Their activities have been hidden from the public gaze (= people’s eyes or attention ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动一直在避开公众的视线。

sentences.english: He is adored by his public.
sentences.chinese: 他深受支持者喜爱。

detailed_translations.english: relating to all the ordinary people in a country, who are not members of the government or do not have important jobs
ordinary people who do not work for the government or have any special position in society

name: transport
trans: 运输, 交通运输系统

sentences.english: trucks used for transporting oil
sentences.chinese: 运输石油的卡车

sentences.english: Canals were used for the transport of goods.
sentences.chinese: 利用运河来运输货物。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, people etc from one place to another in a vehicle
the process or business of taking goods from one place to another

sentences.english: The skyscraper towers into the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 那幢摩天大楼高耸入云。

sentences.english: The majesty of the skyscraper awed me .
sentences.chinese: 这幢摩天大厦的雄伟气势令我惊叹。

sentences.english: Suddenly, a top needle of a skyscraper is pressing toward him. He fails to dodge and bumps heavily on the concrete needle.
sentences.chinese: 突然，一座摩天大厦的尖型顶柱朝他逼来，他躲避不及，重重地撞在混凝土顶柱上。

detailed_translations.english: a very tall modern city building

sentences.english: Much of the land was of poor quality.
sentences.chinese: 很多地的土质很差。

sentences.english: Use only high quality ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 只使用上等的材料。

sentences.english: the drug’s addictive quality
sentences.chinese: 毒品令人上瘾的特性

detailed_translations.english: how good or bad something is

name: cost
trans: 费用, 花费, 开销

sentences.english: I offered to pay the cost of the taxi.
sentences.chinese: 我提出支付出租车费。

sentences.english: Insurance to cover the cost of a funeral is possible.
sentences.chinese: 可以用保险支付葬礼费用。

sentences.english: This doesn’t include the cost of repairing the damage.
sentences.chinese: 这不包括修理破损的费用。

sentences.english: the terrible cost of the war in death and suffering
sentences.chinese: 这场战争造成的死亡与苦难的惨重代价

sentences.english: low cost housing
sentences.chinese: 低成本住宅

sentences.english: the high cost of production
sentences.chinese: 很高的生产成本

sentences.english: A cassette/radio is included at no extra cost .
sentences.chinese: 附送一台卡式收录机。

sentences.english: The funds will just cover the museum’s running costs .
sentences.chinese: 这些资金只够支付博物馆的运转费用。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you have to pay in order to buy, do, or produce something

sentences.english: modern/classical/medieval etc architecture
sentences.chinese: 现代/古典/中世纪等的建筑风格

sentences.english: He studied architecture at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学里读的是建筑学。

detailed_translations.english: the style and design of a building or buildings

sentences.english: local hospital
sentences.chinese: 当地医院

sentences.english: local residents
sentences.chinese: 本地居民

sentences.english: a local infection
sentences.chinese: 局部感染

detailed_translations.english: relating to the particular area you live in, or the area you are talking about

sentences.english: The hotel is in the city centre, close to shops and local amenities.
sentences.chinese: 该酒店位于市中心，紧邻商店和当地的便利设施。

sentences.english: houses that lack basic amenities
sentences.chinese: 缺乏基本生活设施的房屋

detailed_translations.chinese: 舒适；礼仪；愉快；便利设施
detailed_translations.english: something that makes a place comfortable or easy to live in

sentences.english: an alarm system
sentences.chinese: 警报系统

sentences.english: a well-designed heating system
sentences.chinese: 设计良好的供暖系统

sentences.english: the digestive system
sentences.chinese: 消化系统

sentences.english: the railway system
sentences.chinese: 铁路系统

detailed_translations.chinese: 系统； 制度， 体制； 方法， 做法； 身体
detailed_translations.english: a group of related parts that work together as a whole for a particular purpose

sentences.english: There was still one little nagging doubt at the back of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的心头仍有一丝挥之不去的疑虑。

sentences.english: Kim never doubted his story.
sentences.chinese: 例句：金对于他讲的事情从不怀疑。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being not sure whether something is true or right
to think that something may not be true or that it is unlikely

sentences.english: They won quite easily.
sentences.chinese: 他们赢得相当轻松。

sentences.english: We found the house easily enough.
sentences.chinese: 我们轻轻松松就找到了房子。

detailed_translations.english: without problems or difficulties

sentences.english: a London suburb
sentences.chinese: 一个伦敦郊区

sentences.english: a kid from the suburbs
sentences.chinese: 来自郊区的小孩子

detailed_translations.chinese: 郊区， 郊外， 近郊
detailed_translations.english: an area where people live which is away from the centre of a town or city

sentences.english: a house in a pleasant suburban district
sentences.chinese: 地处宜人郊区的一幢房屋

detailed_translations.english: an area of a town or the countryside, especially one with particular features

sentences.english: They are both blonde, but there the similarity ends .
sentences.chinese: 他们俩都是金发，但相同之处也就仅此而已。

detailed_translations.english: if there is a similarity between two things or people, they are similar in some way

sentences.english: Despite all our efforts to save the school, the authorities decided to close it.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我们竭力想保住这所学校，当局还是决定把它关闭。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something happens or is true even though something else might have prevented it

sentences.english: a south-facing aspect
sentences.chinese: 朝南方向

detailed_translations.english: one part of a situation, idea, plan etc that has many parts

sentences.english: There’s a nasty bug going round (=  that a lot of people have caught  ) .
sentences.chinese: 现在流行着一种很烦人的传染病。

sentences.english: a 24-hour flu bug
sentences.chinese: 一天即愈的流感

detailed_translations.chinese: 虫子；小病；故障，缺陷；窃听器
detailed_translations.english: an illness that people catch very easily from each other but is not very serious

detailed_translations.chinese: 烦扰， 纠缠； 在…装窃听器
detailed_translations.english: to put a  bug (=  small piece of electronic equipment  )  somewhere secretly in order to listen to conversations

sentences.english: It took an extraordinary amount of work.
sentences.chinese: 这费了相当多的功夫。

sentences.english: It’s extraordinary that he should make exactly the same mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 真想不到他又犯了完全相同的错误。

sentences.english: The U.S. has called for an extraordinary emergency meeting of the UN Human Rights Commission to examine the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 美国已要求召开一次联合国人权委员特别紧急会议来调查这次危机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非同寻常的；特别的（会议）
detailed_translations.english: very unusual or surprising

sentences.english: Fuel is cheaper on the French side of the border.
sentences.chinese: 燃料在边境那边的法国要便宜些。

sentences.english: A man stood watching me from the other side of the road.
sentences.chinese: 有个男人站在马路的对面看着我。

sentences.english: His friends and family were all on the other side of the world.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友和家人都在地球的另一边。

sentences.english: The restaurant was empty apart from another couple on the far side of the room (= the area that is furthest away from you ) .
sentences.chinese: 饭店里空空的，只有最那边还有一对夫妇。

sentences.english: He is in charge of the civilian side of the UN mission.
sentences.chinese: 他在联合国使团中负责平民方面的事务。

sentences.english: Frank sided with David against their mother.
sentences.chinese: 弗兰克站在戴维一边反对妈妈。

sentences.english: Hannah slipped out through a side exit.
sentences.chinese: 汉娜从一个侧门溜了出去。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two areas that are on the left or the right of an imaginary line, or on the left or the right of a border, wall, river etc
to support or argue against a person or group in a quarrel, fight etc
in or on the side of something

sentences.english: subjects as diverse as pop music and archaeology
sentences.chinese: 像流行音乐和考古学这样各不相同的学科

detailed_translations.english: very different from each other

sentences.english: Hamlet, Act 5 Scene 2
sentences.chinese: 《哈姆雷特》第5幕第2场

sentences.english: battle scenes
sentences.chinese: 战斗场面

sentences.english: The police soon arrived at the scene of the crime .
sentences.chinese: 警察很快就到达了案发现场。

sentences.english: He photographed a wide range of street scenes.
sentences.chinese: 他拍下了丰富多彩的街景。

detailed_translations.english: part of a play during which there is no change in time or place

name: location
trans: 位置, 场所, 所在地

sentences.english: The main problem for engineers was the location of underground rivers in the area.
sentences.chinese: 工程师们面临的主要难题是要确定该地区地下河的位置。

detailed_translations.english: the act of finding the position of something

sentences.english: Nearly 70 percent of the population still live in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 人口中差不多有70%仍住在乡村。

sentences.english: Most of the world’s population doesn’t get enough to eat.
sentences.chinese: 世界上大多数人都吃不饱。

detailed_translations.english: the number of people living in a particular area, country etc

name: metropolis
trans: 大城市; 首都; 首府

sentences.english: The city has become a huge, bustling metropolis.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市已变成繁忙的大都市。

detailed_translations.english: a very large city that is the most important city in a country or area

sentences.english: Iterates may be categorized into stable and unstable sets depending on whether a neighborhood under iteration converges or diverges. Some move toward stability, others away.
sentences.chinese: 根据一个受迭代影响的社区是聚合还是发散，迭代可以被归类到稳定和不稳定集。有些转向稳定，有些转离。

sentences.english: a little fishing village
sentences.chinese: 一座小渔村

detailed_translations.english: a very small town in the countryside

sentences.english: You didn’t measure the angle accurately.
sentences.chinese: 你没有量准角度。

detailed_translations.english: the space between two straight lines or surfaces that join each other, measured in degrees

sentences.english: a long, straight road
sentences.chinese: 一条笔直的长路

sentences.english: Try to keep your legs straight.
sentences.chinese: 尽量把腿伸直。

sentences.english: Always lift with a straight back.
sentences.chinese: 提东西的时候，一定要把背挺直。

sentences.english: her long, straight black hair
sentences.chinese: 她又长又直的黑发

sentences.english: They sat down in a straight line .
sentences.chinese: 他们坐成一直溜儿。

sentences.english: The road was dead straight (= completely straight ) .
sentences.chinese: 那条路是笔直的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直的；连续的；笔直的；正直的；整齐的；异性恋的
detailed_translations.english: something that is straight does not bend or curve

detailed_translations.chinese: 直接地；不断地；立即；坦率地
detailed_translations.english: in a level or correct position

detailed_translations.chinese: 直；直线；直男，直女，异性恋者
detailed_translations.english: the straight part of a  racetrack

name: sympathize
trans: 同情; 吊慰; 怜悯; 体谅, 谅解

sentences.english: I sympathize, but I don’t know how to help.
sentences.chinese: 我很同情，但不知道如何帮忙。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry for someone because you understand their problems

sentences.english: Lie in a comfortable position .
sentences.chinese: 以一个舒服的姿势躺下。

sentences.english: Our hotel was in a superb central position near St Mark’s Square.
sentences.chinese: 我们的酒店处于极佳的中心位置，在圣马克广场附近。

sentences.english: Bruce is thinking of applying for the position.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯正在考虑申请那个职位。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone is standing, sitting, or lying

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

sentences.english: Edward can’t be here today, but he sends his apologies .
sentences.chinese: 爱德华今天来不了，他向大家表示歉意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 道歉；谢罪；辩护；勉强的替代物
detailed_translations.english: something that you say or write to show that you are sorry for doing something wrong

sentences.english: The red light means ‘Stop’.
sentences.chinese: 红灯表示“停”。

sentences.english: This light means you’re running low on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 这个灯亮说明汽油不多了。

detailed_translations.english: to have or represent a particular meaning

name: responsibility
trans: 责任, 负担, 职责

sentences.english: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 凯利获得提升，这意味着钱多了，责任也更大了。

detailed_translations.english: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

sentences.english: He used to buy them expensive presents, out of guilt.
sentences.chinese: 出于内疚，他以前总是给他们买昂贵的礼物。

sentences.english: He felt an enormous sense of guilt when he thought about how he’d treated her.
sentences.chinese: 他想到自己那样对待她，心里非常歉疚。

sentences.english: He did not deny his guilt.
sentences.chinese: 他没有否认自己有罪。

sentences.english: His guilt was proved beyond all doubt by the prosecution.
sentences.chinese: 他的罪行已被原告方证实确凿无疑。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of shame and sadness because you know that you have done something wrong

sentences.english: The old ethic of hard work has given way to a new ethic of instant gratification.
sentences.chinese: 旧有的崇尚勤勉的道德观已被及时行乐的新观念所取代。

detailed_translations.english: a general idea or belief that influences people’s behaviour and attitudes

sentences.english: The advice in the booklet reflects the practical experience we have gained (= experience gained by actually doing something, rather than knowledge from books etc ).
sentences.chinese: 小册子中的建议反映了我们所获得的实践经验。

sentences.english: I had some experience in fashion design.
sentences.chinese: 我有一些时装设计方面的经验。

sentences.english: She was turned down on the grounds of lack of experience.
sentences.chinese: 她因缺乏经验而被拒绝。

sentences.english: The book is based on personal experience .
sentences.chinese: 本书是根据个人经历写成的。

detailed_translations.english: knowledge or skill that you gain from doing a job or activity, or the process of doing this

sentences.english: Reporters asked him to clarify his position (= say exactly what his beliefs are ) on welfare reform.
sentences.chinese: 记者们要求他阐明他在福利改革问题上的立场。

detailed_translations.english: to make something clearer or easier to understand

sentences.english: He was too far away to be able to identify faces.
sentences.chinese: 他离得太远，没法看面孔认出谁是谁。

sentences.english: The police took fingerprints and identified the body.
sentences.chinese: 警方采集了指纹，对尸体作了身份确认。

detailed_translations.english: to recognize and correctly name someone or something

name: principle
trans: 原则, 主义, 原理, 信条

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

sentences.english: Then, with sudden resolution, she stood up.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她突然很坚决地站了起来。

sentences.english: She made a resolution to visit her relatives more often.
sentences.chinese: 她决定要多走走亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being resolute or determined

sentences.english: a moral dilemma
sentences.chinese: 道德上进退两难的窘境

sentences.english: This placed Robert Kennedy in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 这让罗伯特·肯尼迪陷入了两难的境地。

sentences.english: Many women are faced with the dilemma of choosing between work and family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 许多女性面临着出去工作还是照顾家庭的两难境地。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what to do, because all the choices seem equally good or equally bad

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题，就是将由谁来负责。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered

sentences.english: His behaviour could easily be misconstrued.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为容易被误解。

detailed_translations.english: to  misunderstand  something that someone has said or done

sentences.english: Which direction did they go in ?
sentences.chinese: 他们朝哪个方向走了？

sentences.english: A very helpful woman gave me directions to the police station.
sentences.chinese: 一个很热心的妇女给我指了去警察局的路。

sentences.english: Be sure you read the directions before using any piece of equipment.
sentences.chinese: 使用任何设备之前一定要先阅读操作指南。

detailed_translations.english: the way something or someone moves, faces, or is aimed

sentences.english: Andy’s doing a one-year journalism course.
sentences.chinese: 安迪正在修读为期一年的新闻课程。

sentences.english: During the course of our conversation, it emerged that Bob had been in prison.
sentences.chinese: 我们在谈话过程中得知鲍勃坐过牢。

sentences.english: We had fish for the main course.
sentences.chinese: 我们的主菜是鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a series of lessons in a particular subject

name: compromise
trans: 妥协,和解;妥协方案,折衷办法

sentences.english: She admitted that she was unable to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 她承认自己无法作出妥协。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妥协； 危及； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement

sentences.english: Digital cell phones offer more security, but the downside is that they have less power.
sentences.chinese: 数字手机安全性更好，但其劣势在于电力不足。

detailed_translations.chinese: 负面，缺点；下降趋势；底侧

sentences.english: The upside of the whole thing is that we got a free trip to Jamaica.
sentences.chinese: 整个事情的好处是我们得到一次免费去牙买加的机会。

sentences.english: more lay-offs in the car industry
sentences.chinese: 汽车行业更多的裁员

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when an employer ends a worker’s employment for a temporary period of time because there is not enough work

sentences.english: She shook him to wake him up.
sentences.chinese: 她摇摇他，想把他叫醒。

sentences.english: Shake the bottle before you open it.
sentences.chinese: 打开瓶子之前先摇一摇。

sentences.english: The whole house started to shake.
sentences.chinese: 整幢房子摇晃起来。

sentences.english: The car shook as it went over a bump.
sentences.chinese: 汽车驶过一个隆起的地方时颠了一下。

sentences.english: The little boy’s hand was shaking.
sentences.chinese: 这小男孩的手在发抖。

sentences.english: Give the bottle a good shake before use.
sentences.chinese: 使用前要用力摇晃瓶子

sentences.english: His confidence was badly shaken.
sentences.chinese: 他的自信心受到很大的打击。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly from side to side or up and down, usually with a lot of force, or to make something or someone do this
if you give something a shake, you move it up and down or from side to side

sentences.english: Many people drowned when the boat overturned.
sentences.chinese: 船翻后许多人淹死了。

sentences.english: Jane was drowned in the river.
sentences.chinese: 简在那条河里溺水身亡。

detailed_translations.english: to die from being under water for too long, or to kill someone in this way

name: unpredictable
trans: 无法预料的; 不可预知的

sentences.english: He is utterly unpredictable.
sentences.chinese: 他这个人完全让人捉摸不透。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可预知的；不定的；出乎意料的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone or something as unpredictable, you mean that you cannot tell what they are going to do or how they are going to behave

name: overtime
trans: 加班; 加班时间; 超过时间

sentences.english: six hours’ overtime
sentences.chinese: 六小时的加班

sentences.english: They’re working overtime to get the job finished.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在加班赶工。

sentences.english: He’s been doing a lot of overtime recently.
sentences.chinese: 他近来加班很多。

sentences.english: Many employees work countless hours of unpaid overtime.
sentences.chinese: 许多员工无偿加班无数个小时。

sentences.english: Many of our offices will be working on overtime until the end of the year.
sentences.chinese: 我们的许多办事处都要加班到年底。

detailed_translations.chinese: [劳经] 加班时间；延长时间；加时赛
detailed_translations.english: time that you spend working in your job in addition to your normal working hours

sentences.english: He was asked to manage a new department.
sentences.chinese: 他被要求去管理一个新的部门。

sentences.english: Managing a football team is harder than you think.
sentences.chinese: 管理一支足球队比你想象的要难。

sentences.english: The company had been very badly managed.
sentences.chinese: 公司管理非常糟糕。

sentences.english: I don’t know how I’ll manage it , but I’ll be there.
sentences.chinese: 我还不知道怎么去，但我会去的。

sentences.english: I don’t know how she manages with seven children.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道七个孩子她是怎么应付的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理；设法；成功应付，对付
detailed_translations.english: to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it

name: meet
trans: 应付, 迎合, 满足

sentences.english: You’ll never guess who I met in town.
sentences.chinese: 你绝对猜不出我在镇上碰到谁了。

sentences.english: I was worried I might meet Henry on the bus.
sentences.chinese: 我担心可能会在公共汽车上遇到亨利。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone by chance and talk to them
to see someone by chance and talk to them

sentences.english: The operation was successful.
sentences.chinese: 手术成功了。

sentences.english: a highly successful (= very successful ) meeting
sentences.chinese: 十分成功的会议

detailed_translations.english: achieving what you wanted, or having the effect or result you intended

name: overwhelm
trans: 战胜; 压倒; 征服; 覆盖

sentences.english: But the various pros and cons should not blindly overwhelm one another.
sentences.chinese: 但是，众多的利弊得失不应盲目的一个压倒另一个。

sentences.english: We try not to think about it because it would overwhelm us to an extent that we would just vegetate.
sentences.chinese: 我们尽量不去想它，因为在某种我们能够想像到的程度上他会压倒我们。

sentences.english: For example, in a situation in which several bystanders need to band together to overwhelm a perpetrator, they will be more likely to act collectively than to act alone.
sentences.chinese: 例如, 就有这样一种情况， 在只有几个旁观者需要联合起来才能压倒一个罪犯的情况下, 他们就可能会更多地采取集体行动。

detailed_translations.english: if water overwhelms an area of land, it covers it completely and suddenly

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

sentences.english: She tried to focus her mind on her work.
sentences.chinese: 她试图集中精神干活。

sentences.english: He focused his blue eyes on her.
sentences.chinese: 他那蓝色的眼睛注视着她。

sentences.english: Eggs became the focus for the food poisoning scare.
sentences.chinese: 鸡蛋成了食物中毒恐慌的焦点。

detailed_translations.english: to give attention, effort, etc. to one particular subject, situation or person rather than another
the thing, person, situation etc that people pay special attention to

sentences.english: There is no target date for completion of the new project.
sentences.chinese: 这个新的项目何时完工没有预定日期。

sentences.english: The government may fail to meet (= achieve ) its target of recycling 25% of domestic waste.
sentences.chinese: 政府可能达不到回收利用25%的生活垃圾的目标。

sentences.english: Jiang set annual growth targets of 8–9%.
sentences.chinese: 江确定了8%至9%的年增长目标。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying to achieve, such as a total, an amount, or a time
to make something have an effect on a particular limited group or area

sentences.english: He was a hard-working, honest man.
sentences.chinese: 他勤奋老实。

sentences.english: Ann had an honest face.
sentences.chinese: 安有一张诚实的面孔。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is honest always tells the truth and does not cheat or steal

name: clear
trans: 清楚的, 容易理解的

sentences.english: clear instructions
sentences.chinese: 明确的指示

sentences.english: The question wasn’t very clear.
sentences.chinese: 这问题不是很清楚。

sentences.english: It’s the clearest guide I’ve used.
sentences.chinese: 我从没用过这么清晰易懂的指南。

sentences.english: Perhaps I tried to cover too much and didn’t make myself clear (= express myself well ) .
sentences.chinese: 可能是我涉及的内容太多，没有表达清楚。

sentences.english: If you don’t understand, it’s best to say so and get things clear .
sentences.chinese: 如果你不明白，那就最好照直说并把事情弄清楚。

sentences.english: If I catch you smoking again, you’re grounded. Do I make myself clear (= used when you are angry ) ?
sentences.chinese: 如果再让我发现你抽烟，我就罚你不准出门。我的话你听清楚了吗？

sentences.english: Snowplows have been out clearing the roads.
sentences.chinese: 扫雪机已经出动，去清扫路面了。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a simple and direct way so that people understand
to make somewhere emptier or tidier by removing things from it

sentences.english: I’m always working under pressure to meet deadlines (= finish something on time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我总是在赶工期的压力下工作。

detailed_translations.english: a date or time by which you have to do or complete something

sentences.english: a nuclear limitation treaty
sentences.chinese: 核限制条约

detailed_translations.chinese: 限制， 限度； 局限
detailed_translations.english: the act or process of controlling or reducing something

sentences.english: They had to struggle against all kinds of adversity.
sentences.chinese: 他们不得不同各种困境斗争。

detailed_translations.english: to try extremely hard to achieve something, even though it is very difficult

sentences.english: He threw the door open and ran down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地打开门，往楼下跑去。

sentences.english: an open window
sentences.chinese: 打开的窗户

sentences.english: The gates swung silently open.
sentences.chinese: 大门悄悄地打开了。

sentences.english: The bar door flew open and a noisy group burst in.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧的门猛地弹开，冲进来一群吵吵闹闹的人。

sentences.english: All the windows were wide open (= completely open ).
sentences.chinese: 所有的窗户都大开着。

sentences.english: The museum is open daily in the summer months.
sentences.chinese: 夏季里这座博物馆每天开放。

sentences.english: Jack opened the window.
sentences.chinese: 杰克打开窗户。

detailed_translations.english: not closed, so that things, people, air etc can go in and out or be put in and out
to move a door, window etc so that people, things, air etc can pass through, or to be moved in this way

name: admit
trans: 承认, 接受, 不得不说

sentences.english: ‘Okay, so maybe I was a little bit scared,’ Jenny admitted.
sentences.chinese: “行了，也许我是有点害怕。”珍妮承认道。

sentences.english: I must admit , I didn’t actually do anything to help her.
sentences.chinese: 我必须承认，实际上我并没有帮她什么忙。

sentences.english: Admit it! I’m right, aren’t I?
sentences.chinese: 承认吧！我对了，是不是？

detailed_translations.english: to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right
to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right

sentences.english: We don’t allow diving in the pool.
sentences.chinese: 泳池内禁止跳水。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone do or have something, or let something happen

sentences.english: I’ve known Barbara for years. Since we were babies, actually.
sentences.chinese: 我认识芭芭拉很多年了，实际上我们从小就认识。

sentences.english: Actually, on second thoughts, I don’t think I want to go out tonight.
sentences.chinese: 其实再想想，我今晚不打算出去了。

detailed_translations.english: used to add new information to what you have just said, to give your opinion, or to start a new conversation

sentences.english: a society run on the principles of equity and justice
sentences.chinese: 以公平、正义为原则的社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 公平，公正；衡平法；普通股；抵押资产的净值
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which all people are treated equally and no one has an unfair advantage

sentences.english: We plan to buy some property as an investment.
sentences.chinese: 我们打算买些房地产作为投资。

sentences.english: a huge investment of time and effort
sentences.chinese: 时间和精力的大量投入

detailed_translations.english: the use of money to get a profit or to make a business activity successful, or the money that is used

name: contingency
trans: 可能发生的事;偶发事件

sentences.english: a contingency plan
sentences.chinese: 应变计划

sentences.english: Add up your outgoings, putting on a bit more for contingencies.
sentences.chinese: 把你的经常性开支加起来，再增加些钱用于意外开支。

detailed_translations.chinese: 偶然性， 可能性； 意外事件； 附带事件
detailed_translations.english: an event or situation that might happen in the future, especially one that could cause problems

sentences.english: Your building society or bank will help arrange a mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你加入的购房互助协会或银行将会给你安排抵押贷款。

sentences.english: They’ve taken out a 30 year mortgage (= they will pay for their house over a period of 30 years ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们办理了一笔30年期的抵押贷款。

sentences.english: We decided to use Fred’s redundancy money to pay off the mortgage (= pay back all the money we borrowed for a mortgage ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定用弗雷德的遣散费来偿清抵押贷款。

sentences.english: Mortgage rates are set to rise again in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 抵押贷款利率到春季肯定还要上涨。

sentences.english: She was having trouble meeting her mortgage payments .
sentences.chinese: 她还抵押贷款有困难。

detailed_translations.english: a legal arrangement by which you borrow money from a bank or similar organization in order to buy a house, and pay back the money over a period of years

if you mortgage your home, land, or property, you borrow money, usually from a bank, and if you cannot pay back the money within a particular period of time, the bank has the right to sell your property in order to get the money you owe it

name: rating
trans: (人或事物按品质﹑ 特性等划分的)等级, 级别

sentences.english: By the end of the year the Prime Minister’s approval rating (= how many people agreed with his policies ) had fallen as low as 12 percent.
sentences.chinese: 到年底时，首相的支持率跌到了12%的低点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 等级；等级评定；额定功率
detailed_translations.english: a level on a scale that shows how good, important, popular etc someone or something is

sentences.english: financial transactions
sentences.chinese: 财务往来

sentences.english: financial assistance
sentences.chinese: 财务援助

sentences.english: a financial advisor
sentences.chinese: 财务顾问

sentences.english: Organic farmers should be encouraged with financial incentives.
sentences.chinese: 应对实行有机栽培的农民给予经济上的鼓励。

sentences.english: It was a wonderful film, but not exactly a financial success (= something that makes a profit ) .
sentences.chinese: 这是一部出色的影片，但在票房上不是很成功。

detailed_translations.english: relating to money or the management of money

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out
